question: The predominant stage of the moss life cycle is the ______.

The leafy stage bears spirally arranged ______.

This leafy stage of moss bears the ______ organs.

After fertilisation in mosses, the zygote develops into a ______.

Large leaves in pteridophytes are called ______.

In some cases, sporophylls form distinct structures called ______.

The prothallus is mostly ______ and thalloid.

The prothallus develops from a ______.

Macrophylls are present in ______.
